description:
misc/emacs: Restore the window position after a successful gofmt.

This adds restoring the window position so that the buffer doesn't jump around after the erase/copy.

messages.text:
Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go/

On 2012/04/03 23:50:26, jme wrote:
> Hello mailto:golang-dev@googlegroups.com,
> 
> I'd like you to review this change to
> https://code.google.com/p/go/

Could someone take a quick look?

Thanks,

Jean-Marc

On 2012/04/25 03:17:51, rsc wrote:
> sameer, maybe?

ping?

On 2012/05/01 18:29:09, jme wrote:
> On 2012/04/25 03:17:51, rsc wrote:
> > sameer, maybe?
> 
> ping?

LGTM

> > On 2012/04/25 03:17:51, rsc wrote:
> > > sameer, maybe?
> > 
> > ping?
> 
> LGTM

Hi, since this is your first submission, and you're a Googler, I'm adding your to CONTRIBUTORS now.

*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=9d6693456f93 ***

misc/emacs: Restore the window position after a successful gofmt.

This adds restoring the window position so that the buffer doesn't jump around after the erase/copy.

R=sameer
CC=golang-dev
